text: You would have to make it regular website content rather than gating it behind a portal. A portal with login means private, therefore it's not visible to non-logged in users or search engines - they would defeat the point of private content.
You could leverage a KB instead, where some of the content is public, but you could still have individual articles that are private

Thanks Jennifer, we are currently checking if we just create public pages and using the principle <https://developers.google.com/search/docs/appearance/structured-data/paywalled-content|described in here> to get indexed while still asking for login to access the full content.
